messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name: '. I will derive this data from the following paragraph: The crime scene was first assessed by Detective Kline who noted multiple points of forced entry. At 14:34, Officer Jameson reported the recovery of a firearm in the bushes near the back entrance, suspecting it t0 be the murder weapon. Meanwhile, Technician Arnold processed the fingerprints found on the window sill, which later turned out to be a match for the suspect identified as John Doe. At the same time, Sergeant Lutz coordinated with the K-9 unit to search the surrounding area for addit1onal clues or evidence that might have been discarded. Lieutenant Park oversaw the entire operation, ensuring all procedures were followed to the letter. Deputy Chief Harmon arrived later to review the progress of the investigation. Officer Daniels and Officer Kieth were tasked with canvassing the neighborhood for any potential witnesses, while Criminalist Dr. Shawcross performed a preliminary analysis of the ballistics evidence. Coroner Dr. Reynolds was called to the scene to examine the body and determine the cause of death. Captain Rodriguez was briefed on the situation by Lieutenant Park and decided to hold a press conference to address the growing public concern. The crime scene log was maintained by Technician O'Neal who recorded all personnel movements in and out of the designated area. Finally, Detective Moreno took statements from the individuals detained nearby who were later cleared of any involvement.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Detective KlineOfficer Context: Assessed the crime scene and noted multiple points of forced entry.Officer Role: DetectiveOfficer Name: Officer JamesonOfficer Context: Reported the recovery of a firearm near the back entrance, suspected to be the murder weapon.Officer Role: OfficerOfficer Name: Technician ArnoldOfficer Context: Processed fingerprints found on the window sill, matching them to the suspect.Officer Role: TechnicianOfficer Name: Sergeant LutzOfficer Context: Coordinated with the K-9 unit to search the area for additional evidence.Officer Role: SergeantOfficer Name: Lieutenant ParkOfficer Context: Oversaw the entire operation, ensuring all procedures were followed.Officer Role: LieutenantOfficer Name: Deputy Chief HarmonOfficer Context: Arrived to review the progress of the investigation.Officer Role: Deputy ChiefOfficer Name: Officer DanielsOfficer Context: Tasked with canvassing the neighborhood for potential witnesses.Officer Role: OfficerOfficer Name: Officer KiethOfficer Context: Worked alongside Officer Daniels canvassing for witnesses.Officer Role: OfficerOfficer Name: Criminalist Dr. ShawcrossOfficer Context: Performed a preliminary analysis of the ballistics evidence.Officer Role: CriminalistOfficer Name: Coroner Dr. ReynoldsOfficer Context: Called to the scene to examine the body and determine the cause of death.Officer Role: CoronerOfficer Name: Captain RodriguezOfficer Context: Was briefed on the situation by Lieutenant Park and decided to hold a press conference.Officer Role: CaptainOfficer Name: Technician O'NealOfficer Context: Maintained the crime scene log, recording all personnel movements.Officer Role: TechnicianOfficer Name: Detective MorenoOfficer Context: Took statements from individuals detained nearby who were cleared of involvement.Officer Role: Detective
